snippet: Despite pardoning four newspaper employees, Rafael Correa maintains that elites run his nation’s news media. Opponents say a new law will hamper coverage of elections.
abstract: Ecuadorean journalists fear new law that would handcuff news coverage of elections is the latest tactic in Pres Rafael Correa's battle against the news media; observers note the similarities between Correa's treatment of the press, which includes televised anti-media tirades and lawsuits, and that of ally Venezuelan Pres Hugo Chavez.
lead_paragraph: Despite pardoning four newspaper employees, Rafael Correa maintains that elites run his nation’s news media. Opponents say a new law will hamper coverage of elections.

headline.seo: Ecuadorean President Says He Will Keep Pressure on Media
headline.main: In ‘Battle’ With Media, a New Tactic in Ecuador
headline.print_headline: In ‘Battle’ With Media, A New Tactic in Ecuador
